results.title: Chelsea College
results.brief_description: This film concerns the theoretical and practical instruction received by students at the College of Aeronautics and Automobile Engineering in Chelsea, England, and the practical application of their highly skilled technical knowledge in many fields of present day life. The students coming from over forty-five different countries are divided into three training groups - automobile, aeronautical, and agricultural engineering. In addition to showing a good deal of detail of the training given, the film displays scenes of the student life out of the class-rooms.

results.title: Cheetah
results.creator_credit: Jane Chermayeff, Peter Chermayeff and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines, without commentary, the physical characteristics and behavior of African animals in their natural environment, including the fleeting cheetah in action on the Serengeti Plains of Tanzania as it hunts its favourite prey, the Thompson’s gazelle. Develops skills of self expression and encourages independent thought in relating visual experiences to creative activities. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Cheechako's first day
results.creator_credit: Film Loft Productions and Derek W. Muirden
results.brief_description: Shows the debut of a polar bear cub in an Oregon zoo, his reactions to new surroundings, the subtle ways in which the mother bear cares for and trains her cub, and the ways in which these animals adapt to the urban environment. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Cheddar Gorge and its caves
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the Cheddar Gorge and its caves from the Stone Age to the present day. Some animated sequences assist with the explanation.

results.title: Checking up (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Parents and teachers may find themselves questioning the value of new methods of learning which are being used in many British schools, and are being encouraged by the Schools Council and the Nuffield Foundation Mathematics Teaching Project. Examines the question of keeping individual records of day to day progress as opposed to conventional attainment tests.

results.title: Checking the system. Pt. II: trouble shooting
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install a gauge manifold in a domestic refrigerator; how to check abnormal head pressure and abnormal back pressure; how to determine causes of several common troubles such as “unit will not run”, “no refrigeration, but the unit runs continuously”, and “improper refrigeration of food but the unit freezes ice cubes”. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.

results.title: Checking the system. Pt. I: general procedure
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install gauges in a domestic refrigerator; check operating pressure, compressor performance, and temperature range of the cooling unit; and clean the condenser and oil the motor of an open-type refrigeration unit. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.

results.title: Checking and replacing a float valve
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett, F.E. Brooker and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates the function of two basic types of float valves - high-side float and low-side float; how to correct troubles in both types; and replace a high-side float. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.

results.title: Cheating
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Moral Decision Making”.
Part of the “Moral decision making” series, this film is designed to stimulate a classroom discussion on cheating. A situation is dramatised showing a student, whose performance has dropped in maths, being offered a chance to see a test before it is given to him by the teacher. With the development of this situation, questions are posed and various possible responses for the student to his opportunity are depicted. Projector stops allow for class discussion as problems arise in the film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
